website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EF 40mm f/2.8 STM barely juts out from your camera, but is capable of capturing some impressive images.

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this lens since 2013 and recently upgraded to the 35mm f/1.4L II and the difference in quality is not that much different for a lot of the photos you'll be taking. This is definitely a must have for your kit if you're on a budget but still want a really good lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: Nice match to a Canon RP with the RF/EF adaptor
customer_reviews.text: I was originally wanting to pick up the RF 35 f1.8 lens, but no one has it in stock locally. I have had this lens sitting around for a while and did not like it as a combo with my 6D. However, on the Canon RP with the lens adaptor, it makes a great light weight walk-around combination. While it would be really cool to have a pancake lens like this with an RF mount, it is still reasonably small, even with the adaptor. Based on the photos of the RF 35, it looks to be about the same length as the 40mm with the adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: GeooeG

customer_reviews.title: Your normal world
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially a "normal" lens on a cropped-sensor camera. If you're an old film shooter, think of this as a 60mm lens. It's a prime lens, so no zooming. If you want to change the image, you have to move around. Occasionally I'll stick this lens on the camera and go out with nothing else because it forces me to think about the image and compose without the benefit of a zoom lens.
customer_reviews.author: TechByter

customer_reviews.title: Nice lens but kind of soft.
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens to use with a canon 6D for a carrying around lens on my professional camera. It is a great focal length for a full frame camera and the 2.8 aperture is great for low light. My only complaint is that it is kinda of soft sometimes. I have used this for a portrait session and it worked fine! Very light and makes the camera easier to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: AgBaby

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a god-send. Is a great "party" lens for group pictures, excellent both indoors and outdoors. The distortion is minimal and color rendition is SO good! Sharpness is very good and focus is excellent requiring very little effort. Is also so inexpensive compared to other lens, that I can't recommend it enough. If you are looking for an all-purpose, semi-wide lens but with similar properties to the 50mm counterpart, this is it. You can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: high quality....low price
customer_reviews.text: Extremely low-profile and lightweight. A very sharp walk-around lens. Not the fastest focusing but still very good. Can't go wrong when you consider the price and the fact that it won't take up any bag space.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great street lens. Makes your full frame light weight and more portable.
customer_reviews.text: Great street lens. Makes your full frame camera light weight and more portable. I use on a Canon 6d. Much less distortion than wider angle options. Don't forget to fine tune your autofocus as you should do with all lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Mark5211

customer_reviews.title: This lens is very compact. The lens is sharp ...
customer_reviews.text: This lens is very compact. The lens is sharp corner to corner and there is very little chromatic aberration. There is a loss of contrast when shooting against the sun, but this is not a problem intrinsic only to this lens. Using awould help. Only complaint: the lens lens wont retract after the power is turned off. I just give it a light push to retract the barrel; I don't think that hurts it. 100% crops from 20MP images attached. (Amazon apparently resized the images from 600 x 400 to 750 x 500)
customer_reviews.author: Stack⠀Overflow

customer_reviews.title: Sharp images, beautiful bokeh.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent lens in durability and image quality. Works great with my Canon 6d ii. It makes my camera more travel-friendly. I'm glad they don't charge more for this lens, but you could fool me into thinking it was worth more! Nice, sharp images. No regrets...get this lens now!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Meyer

customer_reviews.title: great lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice lens. It is small and light, so a great carry-around lens for my Canon Rebel SL-1. It is by far the sharpest lens I currently own as well. Very, very sharp. The focal length is great if you plan to walk around while traveling and just want to carry one light, multi-purpose lens.
customer_reviews.author: a serious reader

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: This lens is well worth the money. I've used it for weddings, engagements, travel, and portraits. Lately I've been putting macro tubes under it for an easy macro lens.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing lens. Razor sharp with vivid color
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lens. Razor sharp with vivid color. You really can't beat the price for this lens. Now that the 50 STM has been released I'm contemplating picking that one up for the additional f stops in low light. I use this lens for a walk around lens and it's amazing. Highly recommended. You really can't ask for much more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: OK, I know there are many good reviews and the lens is perfectly fine. If you need a 'small', 'pancake', 'f2.8' lens then go for it. It didn't work out for me. I use Canon 15-85 on my crop body and I did compare same images from two lenses and decided I don't need one. My 15-85 is fully capable of the same shot with better DOF .
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading this and buy it now
customer_reviews.text: This lens out-performs its 35 and 50mm counterparts (except the 35 1.4 and 50 1.2). At f/2.8 there is almost no vignetting with it on my 6D, and yet it is incredibly sharp from corner to corner. Its size is another amazing feature. It weighs about as much as the nifty fifty, yet feels a million-times more solid. It also focuses much quieter, though it is electronic so manual only works when you half-press the shutter button. This on a full frame makes the whole system a joy to walk around with. For those who care too, its worth two points on CPS as well! I simply cannot recommend this enough. Every amateur and professional needs this in their kit.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly sharp for the price and size!
customer_reviews.text: The Canon 40mm stm lens, is a diamond in the rough. This lens has become one of my favorite prime lens I've owned. For the price, this lens is super sharp, fast to focus and comes with Canons amazing STM focusing motor. I use it on the canon 80d, and I use for everything from landscapes and portraits. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Morgan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great band for the buck lens, but difficult to pull focus by hand when doing video.
customer_reviews.text: The lens gives a excellent image. It looks a bit dinky on my 5D3, but you don't buy things for looks. The only complaint I had..and this was in that I actually bought this with shooting video in mind. The lens is so short and the focus ring is so tiny, that is it a bit difficult to pull focus by hand if you need that. If you are setting static focus and shooting the scene that way, then this is great. Good low light speed and well with the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Crazy incredible
customer_reviews.text: This lens is crazy incredible. The optics are superb. The sharpness of its images will cut you. It's light as a feather and the best thing since sliced bread. I do some pro shooting and a lot as a hobby. All my other lenses are excellent, but overpriced Canon L lenses. I couldn't resist the price and the fact that this is a prime lens (I prefer prime lenses - they just beat zooms every time). Naturally, there are times when I need a faster lens, but this seems to work for me 98% of the time. Other serious photographers look at me and wonder what in the world I have... wait till they find out!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: I learned how to love this lens
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning I wanted to return this - even initiated the return process, as its manual focus was, to say the least, weird. Noisy, and also fly-by-wire, which is typical of STM lenses, I understand. Anyway, I decided to test the lens a bit further on my 6D, always in AF, and grew very fond of it, so I ended up keeping it despite my MF concerns. Nowadays I only used it in AF, and boy I love it. It is sharp, sharp, sharp, focuses quite fast, and is completely non-threatening to subjects, so a great street lens.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C in San Jose

customer_reviews.text: quick autofocus, slim design, looks cool, really fun to work with. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.text: I've used this guy on my Canon 5D Mk1 for the last month now. I love the quality and sharpness you get from this lens. Beautiful portraits, f2.8 is pretty good for the indoor stuff I needed it for, just a good all around lens if you want to carry just one lens. This definitely is my go to lens now for my street photography
customer_reviews.author: AwwD

customer_reviews.title: like the EF-S 24mm pancake and the nifty-fifty (STM version)
customer_reviews.text: The EF 40mm is one of those "just buy it" lenses, like the EF-S 24mm pancake and the nifty-fifty (STM version). They're simply such a good value. The 40mm is well built, sharp and so small. Prime lenses may not be as versatile as zoom lenses, but generally they are sharper and faster. At this price it's a no-brainer, it should be in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compact travel lens.
customer_reviews.text: Took it along for a 2 week vacation trip. This lens really impressed me. First its really compact, doesn't draw attention. Second its focal length is just right. Very happy with the purchase. Its a must buy for travel. Leave the expensive lenses at home.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Villa Jr

customer_reviews.title: Very Good.
customer_reviews.text: Quite frankly ,I seldom use my Canons with anything but big telephoto zooms. So when you are reviewing or downloading your pictures or simply want to carry you camera in a case,this economical lens is ideal. In fact it makes a superb point and shoot lens for my 7D and is like a full frame prime add is very compact. it is also great for movies and autofocuses when you are trying to take movies,depending on the body you own. Some people say it is slow but it is as fast as any telephoto I own,and a lot more tractable.
customer_reviews.author: NicholsonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this focal length for that application
customer_reviews.text: My go-to lens for street photography, I absolutely love this focal length for that application. The fast aperture and low profile are a plus for street photography, as well. However, this is no speed demon for auto focus, though it performs adequately.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelan Rios

customer_reviews.title: Truly awesome
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the lens and immediately started taking shots and when I checked them out you can see why this lens is so popular. I recommend this this lens to experts as well as any beginner wanting to buy an excellent lens to learn with.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Maltby

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Lens
customer_reviews.text: I like to take available light photos of people at family gatherings. Although my 50mm Canon prime provides superb quality, the focal length is uncomfortably telephoto much of the time, particularly indoors. This prime lens is closer to a "normal lens" for the current Canon DSLR models than the 50mm lenses, and is a nice alternative. The price is amazing and the quality is excellent. I particularly like the very small size, which makes my 60D a lot easier to carry around all day while getting prime quality photos. You give up image stabilization, but the size, focal length, relatively good speed, and exceptionally attractive price make this a great lens for your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. St John

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong...
customer_reviews.text: ...Unless you can find another 40mm f/2.8 AF lens for $150. Great lens on a Full Frame. Makes my 5DmkII into a great "walk around" kit that doesn't get many looks and is probably mistaken for a point & shoot by some people. Adds virtually no weight to the camera and focuses quickly and quietly. Not great for manual focusing, but that is fairly self-evident by the size of the ring. I've used it on my crop sensor cameras like the 60D. It works great there, but is more like a 64mm focal length equivalent. The 40mm on a FF sensor is similar to what we see with our own eyes and just works better imho. -Mike
customer_reviews.author: Scuzzle Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Nice and small with a good average range for traveling light. Plus you get the sharpness of a prime lens with the 2.8 aperture. Works great on my EOS R, 5D Mark IV, 6D Mark II, 6D and my friends T6i!
customer_reviews.author: Ry

customer_reviews.title: The perfect travel lens
customer_reviews.text: The perfect travel lens. Lightweight and easy to pack. Didn't see much a difference in picture quality compared to my 50mm. I just got it for the portability so *shrugs* i like it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Perez

customer_reviews.title: This is probably my second favorite lens, besides my 1
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my second favorite lens, besides my 1.2 50mm, it has been a true work horse for portraits, weddings, and street shooting. Highly recommend to all photographers and videographers.
customer_reviews.author: Aus-Monsta

customer_reviews.title: Great color and contrast
customer_reviews.text: The images I get from this lens are sharp and clear. Great color and contrast. I get all of the good qualities from the lens when I can get the subject focussed in time. This lens is loud, and electronic; meaning, the manual focus ring is a trigger for a circuit which tells the lens to change its range, rather than it being mechanical. This is the only lens for some reason I get compliments on.
customer_reviews.author: Grant whitman

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens focuses a bit more slowly than I expected, but it's due to the STM (stepper motor). That motor is very quiet, and good for video, but you can only use manual focus after half-pressing the shutter when taking pictures because it's all electronic. Other than this one thing, the lens is incredibly sharp when paired with the Canon 6D all the way across the frame. The 40mm focal length is a bit weird at first, but I almost like it better than my 50mm f/1.8 Mk II. This lens is so small that it lives in my bag almost all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Zefram

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a really versatile lens. It's not bulky at all and makes toting my camera around easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bill DD

customer_reviews.title: Good images, decent build, a little slow
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleasantly surprised how nice this lens is for the price. I have some "L" lenses in my collection and while it doesn't compete in build quality or speed, the image quality isn't that far off. If you need a lens for shoots that are abusive and it my get wrecked or don't want to be notices in public, this is a fine choice. Or maybe your just beginner wanting a nice prime lens. Beginner to Pro, everyone should have a 40mm pancake in their bag. If you end up not liking it, reselling it used will recoup most of your money, about the same as you would have spent renting it w/ shipping.
customer_reviews.author: N. Lorenzoni

customer_reviews.title: Get this lens over the 50mm
customer_reviews.text: I had this lens on my list for a long time I recently decided to purchased a used one and it’s worth it and like other reviewers have said or will say it’s better then the 50mm. I’ve done 2-3 events with this lens and it performs amazingly.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Family Photos
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd had a polaroid filter, but alas. Even so, despite the SF Bay early morning fog out conditions, got some gorgeous shots.
customer_reviews.author: Saraj H. Cory

customer_reviews.title: A must-have
customer_reviews.text: I've skirted through life with just a kit zoom lens and a Sigma wide-angle lens until now. I'm just another 20-something hipster amateur obsessed with bokeh. I almost considered not getting this lens because I thought the wide-angle lens already filled that role perfectly... but man. This lens. It's small. Lightweight. And the focus on it is just perfect for getting that soft backdrop effect. Recommended for anyone that wants a simple lens that works for most uses. You will love how much lighter your camera feels with this. I actually feel my shots are quite a bit sharper because I don't struggle so much keeping the camera balanced in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: A great prime lens with a great price. =)
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to prime lens for my canon rebel eos t6s, t6i, and t5i dslr cameras. the pancake size is small and great! the stm motor is silent over all and especially during video. auto focus speed is pretty good. build quality feels and looks solid. this is a sharp lens and color reproduction is sweet. a great price for what you get & a must buy for canon owners.
customer_reviews.author: Constantine

customer_reviews.title: Buy this lens!
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction, dynamic images! This is my perfect lens for every day photos. As long as you don't need a zoom this is the one for you. I usually just leave this lens on my T4i because it is compact, convenient and the image quality is superb! It is also FANTASTIC for shooting video (on Manual focus mode). Follow focuses would be difficult to attach I would think but if you have a single focus shot set up this looks amazing. I recommend to Everyone who is not happy with their combo lens images!
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: Lens fits perfectly on Canon 60D. Works great. A nice in-between 50mm and a 35mm for an indecisive person like me. Wish packaging came in a box rather than a giant envelope, especially it being shipped to Hawaii, but arrived in one piece without any scratches or dents. Comes in original Canon box, lens wrapped in bubble wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Aja

customer_reviews.title: compact lightweight good lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens for walk-around street photography due to its compact size and sharpness. I am really pleased with the sharpness on full frame. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: i didn't need it because I have a great 35mm price and a great 50mm price but I ...
customer_reviews.text: i didn't need it because I have a great 35mm price and a great 50mm price but I love how small it is that i use it a lot. also it has a pretty close focus so it's sorta macroy.
customer_reviews.author: Rollin

customer_reviews.title: So Sharp...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it first came out but I've only recently put it to the test. Since buying it I've also purchased other lens's but for a nice 40mm range I always come back to this bad boy. You cannot imagine the sharpness and bokeh that is packed into this pancake. My only complaint is that 40mm is to cropped for me, but I knew that when buying the lens so it's not a flaw of the lens itself, just my personal preference. While the Canon 50mm 1.8 is a great lens, I do prefer this one over the 50mm. This is the cheapest and sharpest lens on the market. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MindcontrolTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a m43 camera that takes pretty good pics with its pancake lens but I've been shooting cross country meets and wasn't really impressed then I got this and put it on my 30d canon which is supposed to be old and such. My lord what a great pearing. In sports mode this blew all my family's modern hip cameras away. Cropping in sports mode should be a failure. With a 30d and this lens--pro quality. Then I did some macro work on the remaining flowers this year in our yard. People, if you can find and older 20 30d Canon, buy this lens and you have what Pros already know about.
customer_reviews.author: TankeryTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite go-to lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional photographer who has WAY too much gear. A friend turned me onto this lens and it has basically revamped me love for shooting things for my own personal self. I keep this lens on one of my spare DSLR bodies, set to Med JPG, and it is my go-to lens whenever I am out with my kids, vacationing, having drinks with friends....it's so small that it's basically the size and weight of the camera body I'm carrying around....and the quality is amazing from such a small, inexpensive lens. One of my best gear purchases ever.
customer_reviews.author: Christine from KC

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight and handy
customer_reviews.text: It is a fact that the pancake lens does look strange attached to a 7d with a battery grip; nonetheless, after spending 4 days using the lens sporadically in Disney World I can assert that the movies of the fireworks as well as the pictures of my grad-daughter meeting the princesses are of amazing clarity and sharpness. Better than I expected. The best part was being able to go on several rides and not having a 6" lens portruding out of the camera and adding a goo pound-and- a- half of extra weigh. It is indeed a keeper in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: E. Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Amazing New Lens!
customer_reviews.text: Canon has hit the jackpot with this new "pancake" lens. I was just about ready to spend more than twice as much on a 50mm f/1.4 lens and have found this to be a great replacement for it on my Canon Rebel XT camera. It's lightweight, extremely well built, has a great focus range, and takes distortion-free pictures at any aperture. I'm planning to do some night time-lapse work in a few weeks and plan to use this lens. It'll be interesting to see how it works. For the money (less than $200) you can't beat this lens. It's a must-have addition to any camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: John Trautschold

customer_reviews.title: It is good for the portraits but only for the portraits
customer_reviews.text: It is good for the portraits but only for the portraits. You can't zoom out. Even though I knew about it, I didn't think it would be a problem until I actually bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Seyma

customer_reviews.title: Surprised with how good it is
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly great lens! For such price i think it is a must to buy...
customer_reviews.author: HZ

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Fast, quiet autofocus and a solid build. Worth every penny, and not just because it's so insanely cheap when compared to the alternatives. Well, a little because of that. I have an 85mm EF (that is like butter) and a 50mm knockoff (that I love) and this falls somewhere between the two for clarity. Extremely pleased with the purchase and look forward to the release of the 24mm version later this month.
customer_reviews.author: MacGhille

customer_reviews.title: Well priced, Excellent lens!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens and quality for it's cost. You can't beat this well priced lens with a f/2.8. I would highly recommend this over the fixed 50mm f/1.8, as you are not as limited with range. Very light and easy to carry around, takes great photos even in low light. I currently use this on my Canon 6D and probably won't swap it out until I can afford the 24-70 f/2.8 lens :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Travel must!
customer_reviews.text: This little lens was a backpacking lifesaver. I wanted to take my camera but all of my lenses were too large to pack. Fortunately this little pancake lens saved the day! I'm so happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Lane

customer_reviews.title: More Pancakes Please
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this little guy! For $100 bucks used on Amazon, I couldn't go wrong. On my crop sensor cameras, it's like a 60mm and very sharp. Grabbed the 24mm too. These pancake lenses rock. I wish Canon would come out with more of them. It also shipped from Korea from a 3rd party and I was a little worried but it was seriously delivered within 2 days. Amazing
customer_reviews.author: VinC710Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Really fills the niche.
customer_reviews.text: This Canon 40mm lens is solidly built and joins nicely to my 5dII. I've found the AF reasonably agile and accurate. Manual focus is spot on. I'm using it, mostly, for street photography where my 70-200mm isn't practical, due to weight, and where my 16-35mm is somewhat more than I need. I've had the lens on camera since received and have used it in a variety of settings: in home, street, during fog conditions at the beach and with temp. below freezing. I've found it to be a great addition to my lens cache, and not a bad price, either.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: Interesting pancake lens
customer_reviews.text: I wanted one of these for a long time and finally bought one when the price dropped. I have been shooting zoom lens for so long it is actually hard to go back to a fixed focal length lens. On a Canon D5, the lens barely protudes forward of the hand grip. Sharp and contrasty. I usually stop it down to f8, set the hyperfocal distance and simply use it as a $3500 point and shoot!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Orange

customer_reviews.title: Great investment lens
customer_reviews.text: What a great lens! It's perfect for indoor and outdoor photos. It's light, fast, clear and produces sharp photographs. It's silent for filming, fast focus for pictures. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: BriannaCG

customer_reviews.title: Canon Rebel SL1 has a new best friend
customer_reviews.text: It didn't take long after I purchased my SL1 to start looking for a lens that was compact, unobtrusive and a good shooter. Now the 40mm stays on the camera all the time! It's quiet, focuses fast and is suitable for almost every shooting condition. Sure I switch to a telephoto when I need to but the 40mm is the workhorse. Having shot professionally (still carrying the F1) in years past I can tell you that one day you will get tired of carrying all that heavy gear. The combination of the SL1 and the 40mm is light and quick, making shooting a true pleasure (again). Canon knows its products and it's customers. Thanks Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Hilburn

customer_reviews.title: A little gem of a lens!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a couple of these lenses over the years and never had qualms about them, i still don't. I love how compact this lens is, it's one of my favorites to keep attached to my camera most of the time. It's surprisingly versatile considering the limitations it does have, overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana N. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: Not to wide and not to narrow. Just the right fit. I paired it with my Canon SL1 and it's so comfortable carrying around!
customer_reviews.author: Joline

customer_reviews.title: and loved the 1
customer_reviews.text: I use a Canon t4i and had the 50mm 1.8 ii. I'm a hobbyist / family photographer, and loved the 1.8 indoors. However, I always found myself backing into a wall, or cutting off body parts in some of the shots I took. I felt like I wanted a little more width for shooting pictures of my family in our home. I was willing to make the light sacrifice from 1.8 to 2.8 to gain the little extra width. I've had it for 5 days and haven't taken it off my camera. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite lens
customer_reviews.text: It is small and light so I actually take my DSLR places along with the crazy amount of stuff I have to pack for my children. Don't get me wrong, I love my 50mm, but it's a little clunkier and it's a little too close for enclosed places like my house. This 40mm is wonderful for tight indoor shooting and outdoor close ups. It's quick, quiet, and sharp. You can't beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D

customer_reviews.title: oddly silent
customer_reviews.text: I mean I knew it would be, since that is why I bought it. But the speed of a dSLR auto focus and the silence of a video lens make for a strange snap-to-focus moment that feels almost like the human eye... not all perfection though... at f2.8 it spent a fair amount of time NOT in focus, as I kept it aimed on my subject's face. But the price is right, the size is amazing and like all the plastic Canon lenses it feels a little cheap on the outside, but the internals seem solid, and the build quality is as good or better than the 35mm f2 or 50mmf1.8
customer_reviews.author: matthew a tarr

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, crisp photos
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the sharper lenses that I own. And my camera is so light with this lens on it. I enjoy shooting with it. One thing I don't like is every time I go to put the cap on I have to be real careful because the front element of the lens gets pushed in if you push too hard making a weird noise. I did it twice. Won't do it again because I don't want to break this lens. It takes really sharp photos...I should know because I'm a real pixel peeper ;-)
customer_reviews.author: C.P.

customer_reviews.title: Canon 40mm lens
customer_reviews.text: Great little lens for the price! While it does forgo image stabilization (IS) for its thin size, the pictures it takes are absolutely gorgeous and capture a tremendous amount of detail and color. I primarily use mine on a tripod, so camera shake from not having IS isn't really a factor for me. If you already have a stock lens and either Canon's 1.4 or 1.8 50mm, then this lens is a good pick for expanding the macro section of your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Sean A Petersen

customer_reviews.title: ... lens is not just compact but Extremely clean and useful. It gives you such range when taking macro
customer_reviews.text: This lens is not just compact but Extremely clean and useful. It gives you such range when taking macro, portrait shots. I couldnt imagine my loadout without this lens. Canon is going to release a 24mm Pancake lens just like this in November. Mine is already on preorder. For the price you simply can Not beat this lens!
customer_reviews.author: C.  Ciofalo

customer_reviews.title: Use a tripod
customer_reviews.text: Image stabilization doesn’t exist, but its a great macro lens with a f/2.8 aperture that makes it great for focusing on a narrow subject. If you’re going to use this lens at 1/60 shutter speed or faster, use a tripod like you should for any lens at that speed even with stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: George Hannahs

customer_reviews.title: Makes the SL1 a Truly Compact DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This little lens attached to a Canon SL1 (promoted as the world's smallest true DSLR) makes it truly a nice, compact, and really manageable camera. The 40mm focal length -- slightly telephoto for a DSLR -- makes this a great all-purpose camera for travel, family events and a variety of other applications. It is advertised as super-quiet in autofocus mode, and to my ear, it meets that criterion exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: P.A.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expecting a decent lens for a great price. What I got however was a great lens at a bargain price! This lens is sharp as a needle and the bokah is just fantastic looking. I have several L lenses and this little jewel is right up there with them in build quality and construction. The only con is the focus makes noise when you use it in manual mode for video and it can be heard from the on board mic on my 5DMKII. I don't use the OBM so for me its not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Win

customer_reviews.title: Great little pancake lens!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little pancake lens! Wonderful for when you don't want even a 50-mm lens. I have small hands, so I have no trouble mounting and removing this lens, but someone with larger hands and fingers might.
customer_reviews.author: suzgrrl

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite lens! It is very sharp and I use ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite lens! It is very sharp and I use it as a walk around lens a lot. People ask all the time about this lens as it does look a bit different than most lenses. I wish Canon would come out with more like this and good ones. I bought the 24mm hoping it would be as good but it was not.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Cochran

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite lenses.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice photog and I use this with my Canon T3i. This lens STAYS on my camera. It really allows me to carry my camera more often because of this lens' compact size. I actually carry my camera with this lens in my purse (inside a neoprene case), and my purse is no big bag. The picture quality of this lens is second to none. I've found f2.8 to be sufficient enough for my needs. Not to mention, this lens is tack sharp at 2.8. This is definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: CurlsAndACam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a great addition to any lineup. It is tiny and has a pretty good aperture rating for low light/indoor shooting. There is no zooming with this lens, which can be fun because you have to really focus on your subject and your surroundings and be mobile to get the shot you want, rather then just relying on zooming in/out to get the content you want. I love using this lens around the house. For the price, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Keller

customer_reviews.title: Pancake lens
customer_reviews.text: Heavens I love this lens. I was persuaded to buy it after very good reviews in photography magazines, and was a little uncertain when I received it, it is so small, and flat, and pancake like, but the photographs it takes are exceptional. I love it too when I want to take my camera with me and slip it into my bag, which I can't do if it has an enormous lens screwed in.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Smith

customer_reviews.title: and I am in love with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 40mm lens to pair it with my Canon 70D, and I am in love with it. For a pancake lens, I always have it in my bag if I want a fairly silent 40mm lens for video recordings. For actual photography, it's fairly clear and fairly sharp for f/2.8 compared to my Sigma DC 17-70mm f/2.8-4. If I have no need for zoom, I would choose this easily over my Sigma, especially such a low profile lens.
customer_reviews.author: Yorugata

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the nifty fifty; makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lens when I found out it dropped to $150 in price. The lens is very high quality. It works with my Rebel XS and Canon T2i. I took some portrait shots outdoors and the pictures were very sharp. The f2.8 aperture means it can be used in low light conditions as well. This lens makes a good alternative to the 50mm f1.8 lens, since the crop factor gives you a little wider angle with 40mm.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H.

customer_reviews.title: my favorite lens.
customer_reviews.text: i'm loving this lens more and more day by day. extremely handy, when i have problems with having more angle with my 50mm, this one helps a lot, especially in small areas. the quality of the lens is better than 50mm (not plastic, hard stuff), and the photos are as almost sharp as 50mm's. be careful about not letting dust into it, than the ring might get distorted.
customer_reviews.author: Eyup Civelek

customer_reviews.title: Decent aperture at a low price. Amateur photographers take notice.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in December and after having a couple months to try the lens. I am still quite happy with my purchase. I tried the 50mm but felt that it produced too close of an image for certain situations. The 40 has eased that issue while still producing a great low light lens. The motor is different for the auto focus then those canon has produced before, but I do not feel noise is an issue at all. I hope to post a few photos taken with the lens in the coming weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good quality lense
customer_reviews.text: Great portrait lense and it gives me nice bokeh. However, I have a Rebel t3i and if you press on the camera a little too hard, the lense will go out of focus. I usually fix this by removing the lense out of the body and putting it back in. It's a bit of a hassle. Also, this lense focuses better in live (at least for Canon Rebel t3i). The lense itself feels sturdy and is small and compact which is great.
customer_reviews.author: VS123

customer_reviews.title: Interesting, well built lens
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I was going to like this lens, but I needed something small and well built, which this is. I have a canon T2i and it worked really well. Great colors. Focus worked well, everything. I'd love to see this on a full frame camera though. Note: it is a slower lens, so if you are traveling and want to take pictures out of the window or if you want to take pictures of kids moving around, this is not the lens for that.
customer_reviews.author: macG

customer_reviews.title: Great full quality images in low profile lens.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first lens I bought after purchasing the Canon 5D Mark III. I have a couple L zooms to put on for most of my shots but this little lens is great to throw on for those times that I don't want to lug around a couple extra pounds of glass. Images are sharp, plays well in low light, and it is super small! For only $150 this thing is a steal. Dollar for dollar this is the best lens you will put in your camera bag. Also works well on my 7D also for good portrait length.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Lense!
customer_reviews.text: A very light pancake prime lense! The quality is amazing. Does have a slight vignette at f/2.8 on a full frame, but not too bad. Its fast at focusing and offers a great focusing distance for nice bokeh. The focusing motor is very quite as well. The focusing ring is at the edge of the lense, so if you have large fingers, make sure it doesn't show in your picture. The image qaulity is very sharp. A great walkaround lense when you want to travel light and not look creepy with something larger.
customer_reviews.author: Bryent Battle

customer_reviews.title: I have a 50mm f1. 8 II and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 50mm f1.8 II and I wanted something that was close in focal length that focused faster and wasn't going to break my bank account. Enter the 40mm pancake lens. It is now my go to lens for everyday shooting around.
customer_reviews.author: bigM

customer_reviews.title: So far I'm very happy with the purchase of this lens
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very happy with the purchase of this lens. I'm still fairly new at photography and this is my 1st fixed lens so I have had to adjust to not being able to zoom in and out with my lens; on the other hand my photos are sharp and crisp. This lens has lived up to all of the positive reviews that I read. I'm happy! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jalaure

customer_reviews.title: Possibly and even better value than the famous "nifty-fifty"
customer_reviews.text: I shoot with a lot of L glass, so it's funny when I find myself blown away by this lens when I do put it on my camera. The images are just super sharp. The only thing is that it will focus a little slowly in lower-light situations, but then it's not a dealbreaker by any means. In fact, I would argue that this lens is an even better value than the nifty-fifty.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Jurina III

customer_reviews.title: Best SLR purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say how much I love this lens. It is so small and so compact, not only is it easy to carry around, but people aren't afraid of it. I took it to India with me in January and have amazing pictures. The lens holds true to the natural colors you see through your viewfinder, I barely ever have to do editing with pictures taken with this lens. The only downside is that this lens is extremely tightly threaded with the camera body.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love the 40mm pancake lens. It takes excellent photo's and amazing video's. I use a crop sensor T3I camera, so it's really similar to using 65mm when you're shooting film. The only way to film using the true value of the lens is to buy a full frame camera. Also the pancake lens is a great lens for low light settings. Because of it's size, the pancake lens is very easy to store. I definitely recommend the 40mm pancake lens.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Cooper

customer_reviews.title: My family day go-to lens
customer_reviews.text: I have used this lens on my full frame 6D and crop 60D cameras and am impressed I that I spent so little money for such a great performer. It is small and the focus is slow-ish but it gets great results!
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best value in a lens by a mile!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe such a sharp high quality lens can be purchased for so little. This lens is embarrassing lenses costing three times as much. I was considering my first prime purchase for my new T5i. I compared this against the "nifty fifty" 50mm f/1.8 II on my T5i. Here is why I chose this lens over the 50: .The build quality of this is great and the 50's is terrible .This lens is just as sharp if not sharper .Colors are more vibrant on this lens .The focal length is more versatile for general use on the T5i .The bokeh is much smoother on this Buy it!!!! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Izad

customer_reviews.title: Small, fast and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect companion to my Rebel SL1. It's focuses quickly and accurately. The lens is sharp wide open. Color and contract are good but shy of canons L series glass. Build quality is excellent especially considering it only costs $150. UPDATE 07/14/2014 This is a surprisingly good macro lens. I took it for a five mile hike at a local park and got good results.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: a great lens
customer_reviews.text: i am a very amateur photographer. i wanted to experiment with a new lens, something simple for everyday use or certain artsy pictures. this lens has been perfect. it is solid yet lightweight. it is easy to throw on the camera and use for things like taking pictures of the kids on field trips, where the small lens is makes the camera that much easier to carry. i am very happy with the purchase, and looking forward to learning more about using this wonderful little lens.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Cathcart

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the 18mm canon kit lens and wanted something more compact for traveling. The smaller size is perfect for my needs. If you haven't branched out and purchased additional lenses, start with this one! The perspective this lens provides will truly transform your photography. I have really enjoyed working with a fixed lens and probably won't switch back to the kit lens again. The build quality of this one is great and I have achieved beautiful bokeh.
customer_reviews.author: brooksms

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: incredibly fast delivery, lenses work perfectly. This picture says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenia K

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, small, cheap
customer_reviews.text: Definitely sharp and worth its price. 40mm is a tad long, on APS-C, for general purpose indoors, f/2.8 isn't THAT fast for a prime, and the STM autofocus on this particular lens is a little audible in video. But still, I prefer this Shorty Forty over my Nifty Fifty. A faster two lens setup (24-35mm and 85mm) would be more versatile, but if you want just one general purpose prime, this one will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens for its smallness, sharpness and the fact there is like Zero distortion ! I use it mainly for photography historic maps, so you can see why I don't want distortion. Its also a great lens if you like to photograph your food - Good in low light, you don't have to be too far away - as compared to the 50mm and its nice and small. I have had no issues yet !
customer_reviews.author: Summit Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Great tiny lens for all of us.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks Canon for making a great tiny lens like this one. Purchase it and you will get a 'pancake' that make your camera look smaller. Some features: - The largest aperture is 2.8, not suitable for taking photos in low light but will work perfect when using outdoor. - Auto focus (AF) speed is not as fast as other USM lens but still okay. - Light weight, plastic build. - Canon brand's hood for this lens is quite expensive. Try the EzFoto 52mm Tilted Vented Metal Lens Hood (easy find on Amazon). Finally, I used Canon EF 40mm f/2.8 STM lens with my Canon EOS 50D for everyday use. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Thao Doan

customer_reviews.title: but for APS-C this focal length is somewhat more useful. Build quality is way better than 50 1
customer_reviews.text: toss the nifty fifty and get nifty forty! I know 1.8 vs 2.8 is a significant difference, but for APS-C this focal length is somewhat more useful. Build quality is way better than 50 1.8. The stm motor is almost comletely quiet so it works great for video recording. Have both 50 /1.8 and this one, and is rarely used.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Werner

customer_reviews.title: I only paid that much?!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really liking this lens on my 7D. Pros: * very sharp, even wide open * very low cost for what you get! * very light, compact * very smooth focus ring * solid build (does not have the toy-like feel of the 50mm f1.8; don't expect L-quality though) Cons: * only the new canon DSRLs can fully take advantage of the video auto-focus Other notes: * it took me a while to get used to holding my 7D with such a small lens * non-video auto-focus is on the slow side, but I can't really say it's a con given its price
customer_reviews.author: Loreley

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it will fit your Canon.
customer_reviews.text: It's really that good as all the positive reviews say. And to answer all the "Does it fit my...." questions once and for all......, if you're asking such question, the answer is, YES, it will fit your Canon DSLR. Also, if your Canon has "EOS" written on the body somewhere - film or digital, this lens will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Digiko

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this lens. I am amazed by the sharpness of the images. I read in some reviews about a problem with vignetting; yes there is some when wide open but I do not find it to be a big deal. The autofocus is very quiet and maybe a tad on the slow side, but again not a problem for me. The lens cap is the same typical Canon design which some do not like but is no different than other Cannon lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: Produces images of sharp Prime quality in both macro and regular applications. Inexpensive, small, lightweight, f2.8, quiet STM focus (with my Canon Rebel T4i on video), dependable, solid build, in a most useful focal length. Shoot wide open for close shots with out of focus backgrounds and sharp foregrounds. Just one thing was left out: the Image Stabilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McLean

product_meta.title: Canon 40 mm/F 2.8 EF STM Lens
product_meta.description:
A versatile, compact pancake lens. A fast maximum aperture enables low-light shooting and depth-of-field control. STM provides smooth quiet autofocus when shooting video with compatible cameras. 
Extremely compact and portable design: Never be without your EOS. The compact pancake EF 40mm f/2.8 STM is very thin, so you will always be able to take your DSLR with you. 
Smooth and quiet AF, STM focussing for movies: Fast, accurate autofocusing ensures pin-sharp images even in tough conditions. Movie Servo AF with STM uses stepping-motor technology for smooth, quiet autofocus when filming on compatible Canon DSLRs. 
Useful low light shooting: An f/2.8-22 aperture range provides control over depth of field, giving you the freedom to restrict or extend focus as required. A fast maximum aperture allows hand-held shooting in low light without using flash. 
Great image quality designed for travel versatility: A versatile 40mm focal length is great for travel. Tackle everything from portraits to landscape and street photography. Great image quality right across the frame, thanks to an aspherical lens design and Super Spectra coatings.

BOX CONTAINS
Lens
